question_stem: Suppose that the following simple linear regression model has been fitted to the Taiwan real estate data from topic 05. The model is Y = β₀ + β₁ ln(X₁) + e, where X₁ corresponds to distance to the nearest MRT. The following output was obtained from Python. What is the 90% confidence interval for the mean for a new observation with distance to MRT 800 m?
question_stem_html:
Suppose that the following simple linear regression model has been fitted to the Taiwan real estate data from topic 05:

Y=β0+β1ln(X1)+eY = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \ln(X_1) + e

where X₁ corresponds to distance to the nearest MRT. The following output was obtained from Python:

What is the 90% confidence interval for the mean for a new observation with distance to MRT 800 m?

question_media.alt: OLS Regression Results table from Python output.

items.code_snippet:
new_df = sm.add_constant(pd.DataFrame({'dist_MRT': 800.0}, index=[0]))
new_df['ldist'] = np.log(new_df.dist_MRT)
predictions_out = lm_2.get_prediction(new_df)
upper, lower = predictions_out.conf_int(alpha=0.10).reshape(2,)

print(f"The estimated lower and upper limits are ({lower:.3f}, {upper:.3f}).")
items.solution_html:
The estimated 90% confidence interval for the mean is (34.592, 36.141).
